API Reference

This section provides detailed API documentation for the cryoDL package, automatically generated from the source code.

Core Modules

class src.config_manager.ConfigManager(config_path: str | Path | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Configuration manager for cryoDL project. Handles creation, reading, and updating of config.json with global variables and dependency paths.

__init__(config_path: str | Path | None = None)[source]

Initialize the configuration manager.

Parameters:

config_path – Path to config.json file. If None, uses default location.

load_config() → Dict[str, Any][source]

Load configuration from file or create default if not exists.

Returns:

Dictionary containing configuration

create_default_config() → Dict[str, Any][source]

Create and save default configuration.

Returns:

Dictionary containing default configuration

save_config(config: Dict[str, Any] | None = None) → None[source]

Save configuration to file.

Parameters:

config – Configuration to save. If None, saves current config.

get(key: str, default: Any = None) → Any[source]

Get configuration value using dot notation (e.g., ‘paths.output_dir’).

Parameters:

  • key – Configuration key in dot notation

  • default – Default value if key not found

Returns:

Configuration value

set(key: str, value: Any) → None[source]

Set configuration value using dot notation.

Parameters:

  • key – Configuration key in dot notation

  • value – Value to set

update_dependency_path(dependency: str, path: str, version: str = '') → None[source]

Update dependency path and version.

Parameters:

  • dependency – Name of the dependency (e.g., ‘relion’, ‘cryosparc’)

  • path – Path to the dependency executable or directory

  • version – Version of the dependency

validate_dependency_path(dependency: str) → bool[source]

Validate if a dependency path exists and is accessible.

Parameters:

dependency – Name of the dependency

Returns:

True if path is valid, False otherwise

list_dependencies() → Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]][source]

Get all configured dependencies.

Returns:

Dictionary of dependencies with their paths and status

get_enabled_dependencies() → Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]][source]

Get only enabled dependencies.

Returns:

Dictionary of enabled dependencies

reset_config() → None[source]

Reset configuration to default values.

export_config(export_path: str | Path) → None[source]

Export configuration to a different location.

Parameters:

export_path – Path where to export the configuration

import_config(import_path: str | Path) → None[source]

Import configuration from a file.

Parameters:

import_path – Path to the configuration file to import

generate_slurm_header(job_name: str | None = None, **kwargs) → str[source]

Generate SLURM header from configuration.

Parameters:

  • job_name – Override job name if provided

  • **kwargs – Additional SLURM parameters to override

Returns:

SLURM header as string

Update SLURM configuration parameters.

Parameters:

**kwargs – SLURM parameters to update

get_slurm_config() → Dict[str, Any][source]

Get current SLURM configuration.

Returns:

Dictionary containing SLURM configuration

Save SLURM header to a file.

  • job_name – Override job name if provided

  • **kwargs – Additional SLURM parameters to override

src.config_manager.main()[source]

Example usage of the ConfigManager.

Interactive CLI shell for cryoDL configuration manager.

class src.cli.CryoDLShell(config_manager: ConfigManager, log_file: str = 'cryodl.log')[source]

Bases: Cmd

Interactive shell for cryoDL configuration management.

prompt = 'cryoDL> '
__init__(config_manager: ConfigManager, log_file: str = 'cryodl.log')[source]

Instantiate a line-oriented interpreter framework.

The optional argument ‘completekey’ is the readline name of a completion key; it defaults to the Tab key. If completekey is not None and the readline module is available, command completion is done automatically. The optional arguments stdin and stdout specify alternate input and output file objects; if not specified, sys.stdin and sys.stdout are used.

load_banner()[source]

Load and return the ASCII banner.

setup_logging()[source]

Set up logging to file.

log_command(command: str, args: str = '')[source]

Log user command.

log_output(output: str)[source]

Log command output.

log_error(error: str)[source]

Log error messages.

do_init(arg)[source]

Initialize default configuration.

Usage: init [–force]

do_get(arg)[source]

Get configuration value.

Usage: get <key> Example: get paths.project_root

do_set(arg)[source]

Set configuration value.

Usage: set <key> <value> Example: set settings.max_threads 8

do_add_dependency(arg)[source]

Add or update dependency path.

Usage: add_dependency <name> <path> [version] Example: add_dependency relion /usr/local/relion/bin/relion 4.0

do_list_dependencies(arg)[source]

List all configured dependencies.

do_validate_dependencies(arg)[source]

Validate all dependency paths.

do_show(arg)[source]

Show full configuration.

do_reset(arg)[source]

Reset configuration to defaults.

do_export(arg)[source]

Export configuration to file.

Usage: export <path> Example: export config_backup.json

do_import(arg)[source]

Import configuration from file.

Usage: import <path> Example: import config_backup.json

do_slurm_generate(arg)[source]

Generate SLURM header.

Usage: slurm_generate [–job-name <name>] [–output <file>] [–nodes <n>] [–ntasks <n>] [–cpus-per-task <n>] [–gres-gpu <n>] [–time <time>] [–mem <mem>] Example: slurm_generate –job-name model_angelo –nodes 2 –gres-gpu 2

do_slurm_show(arg)[source]

Show SLURM configuration.

do_slurm_update(arg)[source]

Update SLURM configuration.

Usage: slurm_update [–job-name <name>] [–nodes <n>] [–ntasks <n>] [–cpus-per-task <n>] [–gres-gpu <n>] [–time <time>] [–partition <partition>] [–qos <qos>] [–account <account>] [–mem <mem>] [–output <pattern>] [–error <pattern>] Example: slurm_update –nodes 2 –gres-gpu 2 –time 12:00:00

do_model_angelo(arg)[source]

Run ModelAngelo for protein structure prediction.

Usage: model_angelo [–local] Example: model_angelo –local

do_topaz(arg)[source]

Run Topaz for particle picking and analysis.

Usage: topaz <command> [–local] Commands: preprocess, model, postprocess .. admonition:: Examples

topaz preprocess –local topaz preprocess

_run_topaz_preprocess(topaz_path, is_local)[source]

Run Topaz preprocess command.

_run_topaz_cross(topaz_path, is_local)[source]

Run Topaz cross-validation command.

do_analyze_cv(arg)[source]

Analyze cross-validation results.

Usage: analyze_cv [cv_directory] [n_values] [k_folds] Example: analyze_cv saved_models/EMPIAR-10025/cv 250,300,350,400,450,500 5

do_clear(arg)[source]

Clear the screen.

do_pwd(arg)[source]

Show current working directory.

List files in current directory.

do_help(arg)[source]

Show help for commands.

Load and return a random quote from quotes.txt.

Exit the interactive shell.

Exit the interactive shell.

Handle Ctrl+D (EOF).

Handle unknown commands.

emptyline()[source]

Handle empty lines.

src.cli.main()[source]

Main entry point for interactive CLI.

Topaz analysis subroutines for cryoDL.

This module contains analysis functions for Topaz results, including cross-validation analysis and performance evaluation.

src.topaz_analysis.analyze_cross_validation(cv_dir: str, n_values: List[int] = [250, 300, 350, 400, 450, 500], k_folds: int = 5, output_dir: str | None = None, save_plots: bool = True, show_plots: bool = False) → Dict[source]

Analyze cross-validation results from Topaz training.

This function loads cross-validation results, calculates performance metrics, generates plots, and provides recommendations for optimal hyperparameters.

Parameters:

  • cv_dir – Directory containing cross-validation results

  • n_values – List of N values used in cross-validation

  • k_folds – Number of folds used in cross-validation

  • output_dir – Directory to save analysis results (defaults to cv_dir)

  • save_plots – Whether to save generated plots

  • show_plots – Whether to display plots interactively

Returns:

  • cv_results: Full cross-validation results DataFrame

  • cv_results_mean: Mean results across folds

  • cv_results_epoch: Best epoch results for each N

  • best_n: Recommended N value

  • best_epoch: Recommended number of epochs

  • plots: Dictionary of generated plots

Return type:

Dictionary containing analysis results including

src.topaz_analysis.plot_training_curves(training_files: List[str], output_dir: str, save_plots: bool = True, show_plots: bool = False) → None[source]

Plot training curves from Topaz training files.

Parameters:

  • training_files – List of paths to training result files

  • output_dir – Directory to save plots

  • save_plots – Whether to save generated plots

  • show_plots – Whether to display plots interactively

src.topaz_analysis.main()[source]

Example usage of the analysis functions.

Configuration Manager

Interactive CLI Shell

The CryoDLShell class provides the interactive command-line interface.

class src.cli.CryoDLShell(config_manager: ConfigManager, log_file: str = 'cryodl.log')[source]

Interactive shell for cryoDL configuration management.

__init__(config_manager: ConfigManager, log_file: str = 'cryodl.log')[source]

Instantiate a line-oriented interpreter framework.

The optional argument ‘completekey’ is the readline name of a completion key; it defaults to the Tab key. If completekey is not None and the readline module is available, command completion is done automatically. The optional arguments stdin and stdout specify alternate input and output file objects; if not specified, sys.stdin and sys.stdout are used.

Set up logging to file.

__init__(config_manager: ConfigManager, log_file: str = 'cryodl.log')[source]

Instantiate a line-oriented interpreter framework.

The optional argument ‘completekey’ is the readline name of a completion key; it defaults to the Tab key. If completekey is not None and the readline module is available, command completion is done automatically. The optional arguments stdin and stdout specify alternate input and output file objects; if not specified, sys.stdin and sys.stdout are used.

Set configuration value.

Usage: set <key> <value> Example: set settings.max_threads 8

do_add_dependency(arg)[source]

Add or update dependency path.

Usage: add_dependency <name> <path> [version] Example: add_dependency relion /usr/local/relion/bin/relion 4.0

do_list_dependencies(arg)[source]

List all configured dependencies.

do_validate_dependencies(arg)[source]

Validate all dependency paths.

do_show(arg)[source]

Show full configuration.

do_reset(arg)[source]

Reset configuration to defaults.

do_export(arg)[source]

Export configuration to file.

Usage: export <path> Example: export config_backup.json

do_import(arg)[source]

Import configuration from file.

Usage: import <path> Example: import config_backup.json

do_slurm_generate(arg)[source]

Generate SLURM header.

Usage: slurm_generate [–job-name <name>] [–output <file>] [–nodes <n>] [–ntasks <n>] [–cpus-per-task <n>] [–gres-gpu <n>] [–time <time>] [–mem <mem>] Example: slurm_generate –job-name model_angelo –nodes 2 –gres-gpu 2

do_slurm_show(arg)[source]

Show SLURM configuration.

do_slurm_update(arg)[source]

Update SLURM configuration.

Usage: slurm_update [–job-name <name>] [–nodes <n>] [–ntasks <n>] [–cpus-per-task <n>] [–gres-gpu <n>] [–time <time>] [–partition <partition>] [–qos <qos>] [–account <account>] [–mem <mem>] [–output <pattern>] [–error <pattern>] Example: slurm_update –nodes 2 –gres-gpu 2 –time 12:00:00

do_model_angelo(arg)[source]

Run ModelAngelo for protein structure prediction.

Usage: model_angelo [–local] Example: model_angelo –local

topaz preprocess –local topaz preprocess

Topaz Analysis Module

The src.topaz_analysis module provides analysis functions for Topaz results.

src.topaz_analysis.analyze_cross_validation(cv_dir: str, n_values: List[int] = [250, 300, 350, 400, 450, 500], k_folds: int = 5, output_dir: str | None = None, save_plots: bool = True, show_plots: bool = False) → Dict[source]

Analyze cross-validation results from Topaz training.

This function loads cross-validation results, calculates performance metrics, generates plots, and provides recommendations for optimal hyperparameters.

Parameters:

  • cv_dir – Directory containing cross-validation results

  • n_values – List of N values used in cross-validation

  • k_folds – Number of folds used in cross-validation

  • output_dir – Directory to save analysis results (defaults to cv_dir)

  • save_plots – Whether to save generated plots

  • show_plots – Whether to display plots interactively

Returns:

  • cv_results: Full cross-validation results DataFrame

  • cv_results_mean: Mean results across folds

  • cv_results_epoch: Best epoch results for each N

  • best_n: Recommended N value

  • best_epoch: Recommended number of epochs

  • plots: Dictionary of generated plots

Return type:

Dictionary containing analysis results including

src.topaz_analysis.plot_training_curves(training_files: List[str], output_dir: str, save_plots: bool = True, show_plots: bool = False) → None[source]

Plot training curves from Topaz training files.

Parameters:

  • training_files – List of paths to training result files

  • output_dir – Directory to save plots

  • save_plots – Whether to save generated plots

  • show_plots – Whether to display plots interactively

Data Structures

Configuration Schema

The configuration is stored in JSON format with the following structure:

{
  "dependencies": {
    "topaz": {
      "path": "/usr/local/bin/topaz",
      "version": "0.2.5",
      "enabled": true
    },
    "model_angelo": {
      "path": "/opt/model-angelo/bin/model-angelo",
      "version": "1.0.1",
      "enabled": true
    }
  },
  "slurm": {
    "job_name": "cryodl_job",
    "nodes": 1,
    "ntasks": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 4,
    "gres_gpu": 1,
    "time": "24:00:00",
    "mem": "16G",
    "partition": "notchpeak-gpu",
    "qos": "notchpeak-gpu",
    "account": "notchpeak-gpu",
    "output": "slurm-%j.out",
    "error": "slurm-%j.err"
  },
  "settings": {
    "max_threads": 8,
    "log_level": "INFO"
  },
  "paths": {
    "project_root": "/path/to/project",
    "data_dir": "/path/to/data",
    "output_dir": "/path/to/output"
  }
}

Analysis Results

The analyze_cross_validation() function returns a dictionary with the following structure:

{
  'cv_results': pd.DataFrame,           # Full cross-validation results
  'cv_results_mean': pd.DataFrame,      # Mean results across folds
  'cv_results_epoch': pd.DataFrame,     # Best epoch results for each N
  'best_n': int,                        # Recommended N value
  'best_epoch': int,                    # Recommended number of epochs
  'best_auprc': float,                  # Best AUPRC achieved
  'recommendations': dict,              # Analysis recommendations
  'plots': dict,                        # Generated matplotlib figures
  'output_dir': str                     # Output directory path
}

Error Handling

cryoDL uses Python’s standard exception handling with custom error messages:

try:
    # Operation that might fail
    config_manager.validate_dependency_path("topaz")
except FileNotFoundError:
    print("Topaz not found at configured path")
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Unexpected error: {e}")

Common Exceptions

  • FileNotFoundError: Dependency path not found

  • ValueError: Invalid configuration value

  • KeyError: Configuration key not found

  • subprocess.CalledProcessError: External command failed

Logging

cryoDL uses Python’s logging module for comprehensive logging:

import logging

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(
    level=logging.INFO,
    format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
    handlers=[
        logging.FileHandler('cryodl.log'),
        logging.StreamHandler()
    ]
)

Log Levels

  • INFO: Normal operations, commands executed

  • WARNING: Non-critical issues, missing dependencies

  • ERROR: Command failures, configuration errors

  • DEBUG: Detailed debugging information

Environment Variables

cryoDL recognizes the following environment variables:

export CRYODL_CONFIG_PATH="/path/to/config.json"  # Custom config path
export CRYODL_LOG_LEVEL="DEBUG"                   # Set log level
export CRYODL_LOG_FILE="/path/to/cryodl.log"      # Custom log file

Command Line Interface

The main entry point for the CLI is the src.cli.main() function:

src.cli.main()[source]

Main entry point for interactive CLI.

Command Line Arguments

cryodl [--log-file LOG_FILE] [--help]

  • --log-file: Specify custom log file path

  • --help: Show help message

Interactive Shell Features

The interactive shell provides several features:

Command History

  • Use arrow keys to navigate command history

  • Tab completion for commands and file paths

  • Command history persistence across sessions

Auto-completion

The shell supports tab completion for:

  • Built-in commands

  • File and directory paths

  • Configuration keys

  • Dependency names

Error Recovery

  • Graceful handling of invalid commands

  • Detailed error messages with suggestions

  • Automatic logging of all errors

  • Session recovery after errors

Examples

Basic Configuration Management

from src.config_manager import ConfigManager

# Initialize configuration manager
config = ConfigManager()

# Create default configuration
config.create_default_config()

# Add dependency
config.update_dependency_path("topaz", "/usr/local/bin/topaz", "0.2.5")

# Validate dependency
if config.validate_dependency_path("topaz"):
    print("Topaz is properly configured")

# Get configuration value
topaz_path = config.get("dependencies.topaz.path")

# Set configuration value
config.set("settings.max_threads", 16)

Running Analysis

from src.topaz_analysis import analyze_cross_validation

# Analyze cross-validation results
results = analyze_cross_validation(
    cv_dir="saved_models/EMPIAR-10025/cv",
    n_values=[250, 300, 350, 400, 450, 500],
    k_folds=5,
    output_dir="analysis_results",
    save_plots=True,
    show_plots=False
)

# Access results
print(f"Best N: {results['best_n']}")
print(f"Best epochs: {results['best_epoch']}")
print(f"Best AUPRC: {results['best_auprc']:.4f}")

Custom CLI Commands

from src.cli import CryoDLShell
from src.config_manager import ConfigManager

# Create custom shell
config = ConfigManager()
shell = CryoDLShell(config, "custom.log")

# Add custom command
def do_custom_command(self, arg):
    """Custom command example."""
    print(f"Custom command executed with: {arg}")

# Add method to shell
shell.do_custom_command = do_custom_command

# Run shell
shell.cmdloop()

SLURM Integration

from src.config_manager import ConfigManager

config = ConfigManager()

# Update SLURM configuration
config.update_slurm_config(
    nodes=2,
    gres_gpu=2,
    time="48:00:00",
    mem="96G",
    partition="notchpeak-gpu"
)

# Generate SLURM header
header = config.generate_slurm_header(
    job_name="my_job",
    nodes=4,
    gres_gpu=4
)

print(header)
